info.name: API Automation Project
info.description:
This project demonstrates a complete **API Automation Framework in Postman**, covering:

- ðŸ” Bearer Token Authentication (dummy simulation)
    
- ðŸ”„ Full CRUD Operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete)
    
- ðŸ§© Data Chaining between requests
    
- ðŸ§  Advanced Test Assertions (status, schema, content)
    
- ðŸ§° Data-driven execution (via CSV)
    
- âš™ï¸ CI/CD Integration (Newman + GitHub Actions)
    

The collection is designed for **learning and showcasing real-world API automation practices** while using a **mock REST API** (`https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com`).

## Technical Specifications

| Component | Tool / Library |
| --- | --- |
| API Tool | Postman |
| Command-line Runner | Newman |
| CI/CD | GitHub Actions |
| Mock API | JSONPlaceholder |
| Language | JavaScript (Postman test scripts) |

## Test Coverage Summary

| Category | Assertions Used |
| --- | --- |
| Status Codes | pm.response.to.have.status(200/201) |
| Schema Validation | pm.response.to.have.jsonSchema(schema) |
| Header Validation | pm.response.headers.get('Content-Type') |
| Field Existence | pm.expect(response).to.have.property('title') |
| Dynamic Data | pm.environment.set("postId", ...) |

These validations ensure the correctness, structure, and integrity of API responses throughout the workflow.

request.description:
## Purpose

Simulates token-based authentication setup.  
No real authentication is performed â€” this request simply demonstrates the use of a Bearer token in headers.

## Method

GET {{baseUrl}}/users

## Headers

- Authorization: Bearer {{token}}
    

## Expected Response

Status: 200 OK  
Returns a list of users (mock data).

## Notes

- No test script because this is a dummy authentication request.
    
- Demonstrates how Authorization headers are passed to protected endpoints.

response.name: Auth - Bearer Token (Dummy)

request.description:
## Purpose

Creates a new post and stores its ID for use in subsequent requests (data chaining).

## Method

POST {{baseUrl}}/posts

## Headers

- Authorization: Bearer {{token}}
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

## Request Body

{  
"title": "{{title}}",  
"body": "{{body}}",  
"userId": {{userId}}  
}

## Expected Response

Status: 201 Created  
Body example:  
{  
"title": "Sample Post",  
"body": "This is a test post",  
"userId": 1,  
"id": 101  
}

## Tests Performed

- âœ… Status code = 201
    
- âœ… Required fields: title, body, userId
    
- âœ… JSON schema validation (flexible types)
    
- âœ… Saves `postId` dynamically to environment
    

## Notes

- JSONPlaceholder always returns `id = 101`.  
    Test script auto-fixes it to `1` for chaining:  
    `pm.environment.set("postId", response.id > 100 ? 1 : response.id);`

## Purpose

Retrieves details of the created post using the dynamic postId saved in the environment.

## Method

GET {{baseUrl}}/posts/{{postId}}

## Headers

- Authorization: Bearer {{token}}
    

## Expected Response

Status: 200 OK  
Body example:  
{  
"userId": 1,  
"id": 1,  
"title": "Sample title",  
"body": "Sample content"  
}

## Tests Performed

- âœ… Status code = 200
    
- âœ… Content-Type is JSON
    
- âœ… Schema validation (checks title, body, id, userId)
    

## Notes

- Works after Create Post (uses the saved `postId`).
    
- Returns 404 if `postId = 101` (handled via auto-fix in POST test).

response.name: Get Post (GET)

request.description:
## Purpose

Updates an existing post using the stored postId.

## Method

PUT {{baseUrl}}/posts/{{postId}}

## Headers

- Authorization: Bearer {{token}}
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

## Request Body

{  
"id": {{postId}},  
"title": "Updated - {{title}}",  
"body": "{{body}}",  
"userId": {{userId}}  
}

## Expected Response

Status: 200 OK  
Body example:  
{  
"id": 1,  
"title": "Updated - Sample Post",  
"body": "This is a test post",  
"userId": 1  
}

## Tests Performed

- âœ… Status code = 200
    
- âœ… Title contains "Updated"
    

## Notes

- Dummy update (data not really changed on server).
    
- Helps verify PUT method and response structure.

## Purpose

Deletes the created post (simulated).  
Confirms that the DELETE endpoint responds correctly.

## Method

DELETE {{baseUrl}}/posts/{{postId}}

## Headers

- Authorization: Bearer {{token}}
    

## Expected Response

Status: 200 OK  
Body example:  
{}

## Tests Performed

- âœ… Status code = 200
    
- âœ… Response body is empty (`{}`)
    

## Notes

- JSONPlaceholder doesnâ€™t truly delete records.
    
- Request demonstrates DELETE operation flow.
